Description: Papyrus; On verso: Demotic text of Tale of Setne (II); recto : Greek text of land-registers from Crocodilopolis, dated to Year 7 of Claudius (46-7 AD). Setne-Khaemwaset II
Curator's comments: Crocodilopolis is mentioned in the Greek text. Although several sites were given this name, the attestation in the text probably refers to the Panopolite nome (whose capital is Akhmim) Bibliography: G. Pinch, Magic in Ancient Egypt (London 1994), fig.23. Recent translations in: W.K. Simpson (ed.), The Literature of Ancient Egypt, New Haven & London 2003 (3rd ed.): 470-89; F. Hoffmann & J.F. Quack, Anthologie der demotischen Literatur, Berlin 2007: 118-37. To be re-studied by Sonja Fodor. Greek text: Kenyon, Frederic G. / Bell, Harold Idris, Greek Papyri in the British Museum, Vol. III, London 1907, pp. 70-76. no. 604a.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (22674) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/22674)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, fragmentary, insect attack, loss, spots Black ink Adhered: glass Displayed in Room 62 until 1997 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Frame: wood Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
